name: Quality Inn & Suites San Diego East County

reviews.text: The noise from the freeway on one sidle of motel coupled with noise of the commuter trains on the opposite side was awful! The area surrounding this motelthe appears very to be very questionable & unsavory. The beds are old and in need of replacement since you can feel the springs poking you in the back. The insulation between the floors is inadequate since from 4 AM on the people above our room could be heard moving around. MISERABLE experience. DON'T stay here.
reviews.title: There is NOTHING quality about this Quality Inn

reviews.text: The staff were nice and the room was clean. However, the noise was unbearable. There is always magazine sales people who stay there. They are up all night long in the hallways. They knocked on our door at all hours of the night. Apparently not knowing which room the sales people were. It was a nightmare. Would never stay there again. The beds were hard and I never got any sleep with the beds and the noise.
reviews.title: Horrible

reviews.text: My problem was the image I had when reading the room description: 2 bedroom 2 bath suite.
reviews.title: Just be sure you know what to expect

reviews.text: What I had in mind and what the room was, were two very different things! IF you understand that this older property has tried to upgrade, that they give you ONE bed and TWO (not very comfortable) pull out sofa beds, and have put two small rooms together to make one average size room, you will be MUCH better prepared :)
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: That being said, Mary at the front desk was very accommodating and kind, as were all the people working there. It is on a little "island" between the freeway and the trolley tracks, yet it is not overly loud (we were on the back/trolley side) and I had no trouble sleeping. Location is fine, away from the city but accessible. Breakfast was basic fare.
reviews.title: Good Standard Hotel

reviews.text: The room was clean, beds were comfortable, decent pillows, microwave and refrigerator. We had requested an ADA accessible room on the ground floor, there really is no ground floor and after we checked in and went to the room to find it was not ADA -- when we returned to the office we were told there are no ADA rooms with 2 beds. This info would have been nice at the time of reservation. However, for $59 per night I would stay again. Motel is about 13 miles from Sea World.
reviews.title: Good for the Price

reviews.text: Creepy, creepy,creepy people just hanging out all over the place. Room was clean, remodeled, really no complaints with that but they really need to lose the lowlifes that are staying there. Really bad area of El Cajon as well. Sorry Quality Inn, but we won't be back.
reviews.title: Creepy location, noisy with the freeway, and they'll rent to ANYONE

reviews.text: Lots of advantages here, starting with an actual free computer and printer for guest
reviews.title: Good and Bad....

reviews.text: use in the lobby. Amazing how some hotels have not realized that even those of us
reviews.title: AC DIDN'T WORK. ROOM 90*.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: not traveling for business need a computer/printer, if only for such things as Boarding
reviews.title: Dangerous Neighborhood

reviews.text: We pulled in rather late on a Friday night. We paid for our room and went straight up. My boyfriend went downstairs to get some luggage, and was approached by a man who was brandishing a knife. He got away from him (Thank God) and came straight to the room, where we notified the front desk and the police were called. The knife wielding butthead went to jail, because after he attempted to terrorize my boyfriend, he went in the lobby and tried to terrorize the night clerk...who was on the phone with the police as he was standing in front of her, To make a long story short, , by the time that we finally got to sleep it was after 4 a.m.. We were rudely awakened by the maid trying to open our locked door at 9 a.m....she left and then came back an hour later and pounded on the door until finally my boyfriend told her we were leaving. DO NOT STAY HERE.....not only is it not a safe place obviously, the people do not care that we had been traumatized and only sought to have us removed as quickly as possible.
reviews.title: Twacked out knife weilding maniacs here...

reviews.text: This hotel is not in the best location but it is close to Highway 8. The availability of Hi Speed internet was the main reason for selecting this property but they do not have speed internet so this was a major problem. Housekeeping was satisfactory but maintenance issues need to be addressed. If you select this hotel, recommend that you ask for a room on the side away from the Highway.
reviews.title: An average hotel with some issues

reviews.text: This place gets rave reviews but to be honest, tho' it's not bad, it's not that great.
reviews.title: Decent place to stay

reviews.text: It's a bit difficult to locate off the Interstate, but when you finally find it the family who run it are very helpful and friendly. I paid $60 plus a $10 upgrade for a suite which wasn't worth it - the suite was fairly dowdy. I suspect the regular rooms are almost as good and more modern. The breakfast was also a bit basic and the free wifi very slow , but all in all this is a good road house to stay in.
reviews.title: Will stay here again!

reviews.text: We stayed the room facing trafic high way so it's not very quiet at night with dust in the air if we went out ( we were in third floor). The terrible thing was that some one locked our door after midnight. 2-3 nights( we stayed there 5 nights) there were people talking and yelling so loud after midnight!!
reviews.title: review

reviews.text: I am normally a Best Western person but on my recent trip to San Diego I was not pleased with my Best Western hotel. I called Quality Inn and they were very freindly and set me up right away. The room was spacious and had pleanty of accessible outlets for me to plug in my laptop and relax. Their facility was clean in the room. eating area, pool and laundry area.
reviews.title: Great & Accomodating

reviews.text: I tnk I am a Quality Inn person now.
reviews.title: Scary location run by clueless young couple

reviews.text: Friends and I were on a road trip and stopped in El Cajon as it was getting late and we were all tired. This hotel is located in an odd hard to get into piece of property next to the freeway. Noisy so best to get a room on the other side where only the trolley tracks can be heard.
reviews.title: Definetely not worth the price

reviews.text: We had some issues with the room such as water pressure, toilet problems, and reported them to the young couple who are the owners / managers of the property. They could have cared less and we later found out that a wealthy "uncle" had installed these two to run his place. Very obvious neither attended hospitality college.
reviews.title: Average Hotel w/Issues For Sure

aka: Quality Inn & Suites San Diego East County Hotel
